placeAddress: 50 W 22nd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
reviewText: Literally the best. We use every excuse to bring friends and family here.

placeAddress: 50 W 22nd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
reviewText:
The anchovy is the only flavour I tasted in Caesar Salad. It's extremely overpowering and very fishy.
 
The Carbonade Flamande comes with no vegetables.

The Cheese Croquettes are just fried cheese balls, not croquettes.

placeAddress: B. Cafe, 240 E 75th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
reviewText: Love B Cafe, especially the beef carbonnade, cooked in Belgian beer for hours... so good and melts in your mouth.  Surprisingly good, even in their brunch omelette (tho best for a yummy dinner).

placeAddress: 96 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
reviewText: Steak is chewy and disgusting. Do not order

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: the Matcha Latte was 7 dollars i expected a quality drink,  it was bland, as if the amount of matcha added was for a small cup. it only tasted like water down almond milk with a hint of matcha. the hot chocolate was on point as usual.

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: I always order my 2 glazed donuts from here & they always forget to put it in my bag.

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: The worst bagel I ever tasted. First off I couldn't even eat it so I definitely want my money back. My bagel was not even edible. It's burnt as can be.

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: The bacon was burnt the lemonade taste bitter and sour like it was spoiled and the hashbrowns were burnt too.  The only thing that was good and it probably wasn't good was the bagels but they were a little hard to. I don't ever Want the same person to make my food

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: Coffee and muffins were delicious, but when I got my order most of my coffee had spilled out into the bag because the top was not on tight.

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: There were no tomatoes on the Bacon Avocado Tomato Sandwich. They forgot my Hash Browns. No straw for my Iced Cappuccino. The Sweet Black Pepper Bacon Breakfast Sandwich was dry and could've used some ketchup.

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: The bagel was so hard you couldn't eat it. The coffee was great.

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: The snack and bacon were burnt the plane stuff bagel minis were hard￼￼ The lemonade was better and spoile￼d and the hashbrowns were not good at all whoever made my food should never make food again in there life again this is unacceptable and why would you put burnt bacon inside of a bag to sell it to somebody that is just overdoing it whoever cook the food needs to be fire￼.

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText:
I ordered 6 glazed donuts and got 6 assorted.
Will not order from there again

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: I can not eat cheese and after writing no cheese it was still put in my sandwich.

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: Did not get my  Sweet Black Pepper Snackin' Bacon strips that I ordered twice and they replaced it with tater tots. Absolutely, unacceptable. Then the Bacon & Cheddar Omelet Bites was burnt and dry. They need to do better at this branch.  The only thing that was good is the Mango Pineapple Dunkin' Refresher.

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: They burn the food 9 out of 10 times

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: I was missing 3 out of my 5 doughnuts

placeAddress: 245-01 Francis Lewis Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11422, USA
reviewText: They gave us the wrong donuts

placeAddress: 140 E 52nd St, New York, NY 10022, USA
reviewText: Good food and service is excellent

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: The Matcha Beignets were AMAZING!!! Up there with any beignets I've ever had including ones from NOLA. The ice cream was a great addition. I have 0 complaints, no notes lol def will order again.

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: The Chocolate Basque Burnt Cheesecake (7-Inch) is hands down the best thing youll put in your mouth! I cant stop eating it.

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: Perfectly packed to preserve temperature!

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText:
Their Matcha Basque Burnt Cheesecake (4 inch) is phenomenal. At this point, we've had all versions of their Basque Cheesecake and you trully cannot go wrong with either. 
Packing and delivery is always perfect too.

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: I always get the Rose Petal Milk Teawith Matcha Ice Cream Waffle together.They are literally the BEST :))

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: Super delicious￼! I had the Matcha donuts and rose drink￼

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: We had specified sugar levels for our drinks and they were very accommodating! Thank you :)

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: Ordered the Taro Milk Tea and it was delicious! <3

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText:
i realized i didn't order tapioca pearls in my boba so i was a little sad when they were missing 
:(( otherwise i have to say the jasmine milk tea itself was delicious and the cheesecake was phenomenal!!!  i highly recommend this place :)

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: Arrived few minutes after their promised time but my order is not even picked up.  The casher at front was nice enough to review my order and pick up everything for me.  Cheesecakes are nice but nothing really special to justify the cost.

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: Matcha beignets were amazing, ube was good too!

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: That was bussin my matah cap to another level I almost had a seizure it was so good holy cannoli

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: Basque cheese cake and mango madness are my most favorite! Good quality and delicious food ♥️

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: I love the quallity of their items. Super good. I would recommend the hodduk.

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: Excellent food and milk tea!

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: Burnt cheesecake is amazing!

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText:
The XOXO Shaved Ice was perfect upon arrival!  Wasn't sure if it would melt but it was yummy and perfect. 

The rose petal milk tea is good but the honey boba wasn't really cooked properly so it wasnt the right chewy texture but was soft on outside and hard on inside.  Would do lychee jelly next time

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: Eh okay not the best, really oily

placeAddress: Grace Street Coffee & Desserts, 17 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
reviewText: Beignets were burnt

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: This is the best vegan breakfast I've had on door dash! I got the croissant and BEC sandwiches and it was AMAZING

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: The Romey Sandwich is my repeat order, it's so good. All the sandwiches are good. But I made the mistake of tryingA Side of Mac and Cheese and it was awful. Beyond awful. The turmeric is overwhelming, it's completely inedible, I'm sorry. I'm still an Orchard fan and will get the sandwiches but the mac and cheese desperately needs to be readjusted

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: The Orchard CThe Orchard Cobb Salad Salad was horrible. The avocado was missing and the lettuce was old and the end of the stalk. I will never order anything from them again. I would like to have my $19.00 back!

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: The Bowery Sandwich was great! Delicious and hearty

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: edith is the best sandwich i've ever put in my mouth

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: The vegan crossa sandwic was a total of $28 and worth every freaking penny omg the flavors were amazing it just melts in your mouth

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: Everything is always delicious!! One of my favorite spots to order from and im not even vegan!

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: Best vegan place I've found. Almost everything is amazing

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: Always love their food

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: The Orchard Cobb Salad was nothing more than a bowl of lettuce with a slab of fried tofu on top. I actually thought I had been pranked when I received it.

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: The cheese in the kitten sandwich was not melted / was cold.

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: Best vegan hangover food

placeAddress: Orchard Grocer, 78 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
reviewText: I've been ordering from here for months and at first the food was great which is why I continued ordering. But as of late the food quality has been poor. I ordered the Kale Caesar salad it was heavily dressed with barely any bacon or avocado and extremely salty. I'm disappointed because really enjoyed their food.
Food was absolutely amazing! Delicious and savory. Chicken was juicy and perfectly seasoned

Great Flavorful Food, a Great Atmosphere, Reasonable Prices, And The Steaks Are Way Better Than at Peter Lugers In Williamsburg.  I did a taste test comparison this week and SALUD BAR & GRILL is the hands-down winner.
The  Salud Classic Burger is top tier. The appetizer fried wings weren't plucked properly and lacked flavor, so I'll skip that moving forward. Salud is always a dependable staple.
The fries were pretty good but the Salud Quesadilla with pernil so so good I have a new favorite 10/10
Amazing as always, left nothing on my plate!
Ny steak delicioso!!!
One of the much better mac and cheeses I have had at great value. The flavor is better than most though some placed have slightly more thick cheese sauces and slightly more dry.
I've ordered this shepherd's pie at least five times. it's perfect feeling comfort food
This delicious Corned Beef and Cabbage was delivered on time, hot, and very well packaged!

So delicious with superb food preparation and thoughtful, ca eful packaging.  Absolute best ribs ever -- juicy, fall-off-the-bone, fresh (e.g., no gamey taste) and plenty of my new favorite BBQ sauce.  And the hand-cut chips, saute veggies, fish, seriously real ice cream and so much more will have us ordering again often!
Great tasting Shepherd's pie and certainly try the Flourless Chocolate Lava Cake with ice cream! A sweet combo!
All their dishes are truly amazing and fresh.
Very good wings and Mac and cheese
the food was not cooked fully, barely any sauces on the few wings that I found cooked.
Donuts are great and fresh here. There breakfast is great sausage and eggs on a crousant . A must every morning.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Great spot for dinner and drinks.  Katie was our server and she was beyond attentive to our needs. She even remembered our drink order from a previous visit. We will definitely be back and will be requesting Katie!!!

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: This restaurant has quickly become a staple in our family’s rotation of reliable places to eat. The food is INSANELY delicious and the staff always makes my family feel at home. I have a brother with autism and Danica always comes over to say hello to him and ask how his week is going. We love her so much! This week we had Jamie who was also wonderful. If you want a delicious meal and a wonderful atmosphere don’t hesitate, check out BJs

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Jackhai was a great server! Would recommend this restaurant for its service.  The food was ok and could have been better. Next time I’ll order the jimbalaya.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText:
I am giving this restaurant a 4* rating for few reasons, first it is a restaurant with a fairly good reputation and is not serving junk food as it is the case in and around JFK where we were in transit .
While this is not a gourmet restaurant, the food is more than decent and the kitchen is showing that they care. Our waiter David was the star of the evening, he treated us in a very friendly manner and was very engaging when time allowed and also upsold the menu . In a time we see so few young people wanting to really work hard, David is a star in the making. Thank you for making our few hours visiting with our son memorable.
reviewTitle: David was the star of our evening and the food very good

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Our server was David. He was knowledgeable of everything we asked about on the menu and gave us great suggestions. The food was great!

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Sehun was attentive and friendly. We ordered appetizers (wings, slidera and onion rings). Not disappointed at all. Will definitely return

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Joann was our server and she was awesome! We had a large group and she was very attentive and accommodating. I wish all of my experiences when I go out with a large group were  this wonderful.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: My first and last time at this place. Take out service is 100 percent slow  and cashier didn’t know how to properly ring up  my order, and I was overcharged. Female servers need to present themselves in a more professional manner. Caesar salad portion small and not as shown on the menu. The rip-off bubble drink awash with ice and small pieces of bubble. What the heck?!

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: The food was pretty good but the service was horrendous. The only thing that came quickly was the check. Will not go back anytime soon.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText:
Brew house Valley Stream, empty tonight. Manager didnt come around to find out how was our service orun food. You would think in a Empty Restaurant she wouldve Thanked the few of us for our visits.
I, didnt enjoy my food,
Dry baked potatoe, 
Dry Grilled Chicken.
Shrimp Scampi was ok.
We been coming since the beginning, different cook unfortunately.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: This restaurant is a fabulous place to pick up food during these hard times. They have amazing specials all week long as well as specific days of the week. It's very easy to order on their app. I have picked up inside as well as curbside. Everyone is totally protected with gloves and masks. They have great pizza's and the spicy peanut chicken with soba noodles is amazing. You must have a pizookie which is to die for (well worth the calories). The staff is very friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant. They have a great deal when you sign up through the app.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: The food is really good here but a little high for me. This more of a couples place.All there dishes are good. I've been at there bar also it is nice. Slow service at the bar but good food.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText:
We came in late after travelling all day. We asked if there was a happy hour & were seated in the incorrect area. 
The music was blaring, we couldn't hear each other speak!
When we ordered, we were told what we ordered would have to be at the bar.
When we moved to bar area, we were then told it still wasn't happy hour!
Starving we ordered the Wednesday burger special! We ordered medium well & sliced for us to share.
It arrived medium, still a bit pink, unsliced! The server took it back & returned to say they don't slice!
The burger was so salty, never again!
The bill arrived with the price of the burger marked regular price.
The server came back & dropped the bill without an apology!
We wont be back!!!

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Restaurant has grille faire, but it's very satisfying.  Happy hour is fun with $5.00 drinks!  I always get a dish to take home, so I don't have to cook the next day.  Convenient to drive and park.  Good service..Just go!

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText:
My niece and I went here last Thursday, around 5:30PM. It wasn’t too crowded and we were seated immediately.  We both ordered the ‘bison burger with bacon’ and sweet potatoe fries....Ummmm Ummmm GREAT! The presentation was ok, but the Flavorssssss, DELICIOUS! 
This was my niece’s first visit, but I’ve been there several times.  We were both delighted with the atmosphere, service and quality of our meals! It’s reasonably priced for the large portions too, (38.00 all together!).

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: My wife and I are both gluten-free and BJ's is close making it our go-to pizza place. The gluten-free pizza is consistently good - unlike some other gluten free pizza restaurants. Last time I was there I had a pizza with onion and pepperoni and it was the I've had there. If you're gluten free and like pizza and beer I recommend trying BJ's.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText:
We wanted to go to the wings place jd when we got there, it was at least a 30 minute wait as we could see that they were very short staffed.  So we walked across the parking lot, walked in, got seated right away, was welcomed by the waitperson, got great advice on the drinks and menu offerings and had a great meal.  

We will be going back soon!!!
reviewTitle: First visit  in a long time

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText:
My boyfriend ordered food from this restaurant last night so that we could eat it at home, re-watching episodes of Game of Thrones.  The food looked and smelled delicious. I went for my salad, took a big bite and bit into a RAZOR BLADE!  I couldn't believe there was a razor in my salad!!  Being that we were eating with the lights off, I didn't even notice it on my fork.  If a child would have ate that salad they would have be seriously injured! 

I was so traumatized from my meal, I threw it out. I do not recommend this restaurant EVER.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText:
So a funny story of how I ended up at this restaurant.  My sister sent me gift cards to what I thought was BJ wholesale club but unfortunately it was the wrong BJ’s this was a restaurant at Green Acres Mall.  So I told her we have to go and see what it’s like and use my gift cards.

What a wonderful food Surprise.

The restaurant is of a substantial size and very nice done. 
The menu is extensive and we tried many things.
For appetizers we had 
French Onion soup in the bread bowl- excellent 
Meatballs - good
Spicy Buffalo Wings - excellent 
Broccoli and Cheddar soup - excellent 
Crispy Flatbread Nachos - excellent 

Entrees:

BBQ RIbs with mashed potatoes, the ribs where so good the meat fell off the bone.- excellent 
Honey Crisp Chicken Salad was of a very good size and was good.
Salmon with vegetables was good 
Chicken Caesar Salad was good 

This restaurant surprised us with how good the food was but the service and drinks was not to standard.
The drinks where watered down and we had to return one because we ordered 2 of the same drink and you can see the lack of consistency from the bartender on the drinks.
Our waitress was very aloof and laid back our appetizers arrived and we still didn’t have silverware or water which we had already asked for.  We ended up asking another waiter that was walking by for the silverware and water. It seems like the waitress continued to forget about us and this was on a Monday afternoon, when there were only maybe 4 other tables to serve, and not even by her.
I must say that I would like to go back because the food was so good. Just hoping for better service.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Service is poor in this restaurant. I have been to multiple BJ restaurants in Florida but this one in NY has the poorest service so far. I went here twice in a span of three days since it is conveniently located to where I was staying and both times, the service was poor. It took a long time for the food to come out and the servers seem to be hiding because they cannot be found. Food is good, same quality as the ones here in Florida. But definitely, service is not the same.
I just love dunkin' donut it's amazing, the cashier is nice and the people who goes there is nice. Awesome place
it is a good place to go, socialize, have some donuts, drinks and much more. You can tour Queens Village once you leave Dunkin' Donuts.
I love their donuts and the staff is very courteous. I also have had the egg and cheese croissants, hot cocoa, OJ and grilled cheese sandwiches.
I love Dunkin Donuts coffee always have it with a bagel with cream cheese nice place typical Dunkin Donuts would recommend to anyone
I stop there at night for a cup Joe, it taste fresh so far. The workers were nice, and they seem to get the job done

If you want a donut from here, go on a diet! The associates sweep while the donuts are exposed.. the bathroom is atrocious and the staff in the morning needs to work in a correctional facility -- they will single -- handedly stop repeat offenders! Did I mention the attitude and no gloves while serving the donuts --NICE!!!!
reviewTitle: THERE ARE CLEANER PLACES AT A FARM !!! AND THE SERVICE STINKS!!

reviewText: Same as any dunkin donuts. But some times they speak another language to other employees which I don't like.
The people that work here are guarded at first but once you give them a smile you get a beautiful one back. Service is good and quick. Considering the clientel they are very patient.

I had the chicken teriyaki crepe which was amazing! Also I've tried the banana strawberry which delicious as well. My goal is to definitely try them all! A must have!
가격대는 $7불부터 있는데 정말 저렴한 가격에 맛있는 크레페를 먹을 수 있는 곳이다. 든든하게 한끼를 먹을 수 있는 곳이라서 너무너무 좋은 곳이다. 크레페는 달다. 이런 생각을 가질수 있는데 그렇게 달지 않게 먹을 수 있어서 좋았다. 크레페를 좋아하신다면 이곳을 방문하시길.. 달지 않아서 먹고 또먹을수 있다.
Stopped by for a lunch snack and T-Swirl delivered. Larger portion than expected, my Chicken Teriyaki was superb but the wife's BLT was excellent!!! We will be going back there again.
I had the banana strawberry crepe with nutella and it was AMAZING! It was made well and it was a perfect light dessert. I will be making a trip back there for more... I wish there were more around.

We visited this chain store in Philadelphia last month and we loved it. We were very happy to see one in this area. We ordered 6 order of #8Matcha Azuki Bean. We were very disappointed!!. We got our order one at the time, since they had to freshly make the crepe, which btw were not crispy as it should had been. After the 1st order came out, the crepe got smaller and smaller, as well as the size of the matcha ice cream. Not to mention that the last order the ice cream was practically melted away. We like #8 a lot, because of the matcha ice cream, since they didn't put enough of it, or even melted, it didn't taste as good as the one we had in Philadelphia. Even though this location is closer to us, we'll not stop by again. It's not cheap, $7.95 plus tax, it would be OK as long as it tastes good.

Let me preface this by saying that I had the opportunity to travel to France when I was at school and so I am a bit picky when it comes to crepes in the states. T-Swirl Crepe is AMAZING. Their savory and sweet crepes selection is magnificent. I had their teriyaki chicken and their decadent chocolate crepe. All the crepes are under $10 and they are HUGE. The flavors are wonderful. They are also very friendly and make it right in front of you. You can add or take out some toppings from their menu as well.
여기 새로 생겨서 몇번 가봤는데 크림도 프레쉬하고 결정적으로 크레이프가 얇고 크리스피합니다. 마차크림도 맛있고 스트로베리랑 바나나 들은것도 맛있습니다. 근데 앉을곳은 마땅치 않으니까 왠만하면 테이크아웃을 해야해요

Stopped by here for lunch. They sell savoury and sweet crepes in a cone. It was absolutely delicious. Had chicken teryaki and got a free coffee and ice cream. Very good price - only cost 7.99$. Really good service. Will definitely visit again.
最近色んな所でよく見かける韓国系のクレープ屋さんです。軽くお昼を食べたかったのでこちらでオールベジの食事クレープを注文しました。デザートクレープの様にクルクルと巻いて仕上げてくれるのですが、具が野菜なのでちょっと不思議な感じでした。それでも味は良くて美味しかったです。
reviewTitle: お食事クレープも充実してるクレープ屋さん

reviewText: I totally recommend the salmon and the Brie cheese with mushrooms. Service excellent and normal prices.

While you might not expect to be transported to a small french dinette in bushwick, mominette is a fantastic way to escape the bustle of the city.

Strong wine list, good vegetarian options, and a good wait staff. Lots of good bars nearby for a digestif or a night out.
reviewTitle: might feel out of place, but it isn't! great dinner spot.

reviewText: ブッシュウィックにアートを見に行ったついでにランチに行きました。残念ながら素敵な中庭には出られませんでしたが、雰囲気のあるカウンターバーを見ながら食事。常連さんもいました。昼間は2人のお兄さん達がウェイター。エッグベネディクトを注文しましたが、いい感じの半熟卵とオランデーズソースが絡まり美味しかったです。ワインやビールも飲んでみたかった。
reviewTitle: 雰囲気のいいフレンチビストロ

reviewText:
Sono stata in questo ristorante varie volte per il brunch e il brunch non è male per il prezzo. 
Così ho deciso di provarlo per cena, ma purtroppo l’esperienza è stata veramente negativa. 
L’insalata sciarpa e secca senza un goccio d’olio e probabilmente non lavata, il veggie burger moscio e stracotto. 
Niente a che vedere con un vero posto francese.
Lo consiglierei solo per il brunch, ma in zona ci sono sicuramente posti migliori.

Firstly, disregard all negative reviews of Mominette - They we’re probably written by pretentious people who wouldn’t know class or courtesy if it punched them in the face.

Mominette is an absolute dream hidden in this Brooklyn neighborhood.  The atmosphere, decor, and staff are exactly what you imagine a French bistro to be.

In truth, the food was good, not great...but the whole experience was simply erotic - Marga from Mallorca serving “old fashions” and oysters and Bertrand from Haiti who anticipates your culinary desires.

Don’t let the location scare you away - come here for a wonderfully seductive date night before walking over to Company XIV on Troutman. You won’t be disappointed and neither will your partner, whether that’s a man, a woman, or both.  Enjoy! ;)

Went for the Brunch at Mominette's and after having a few bad experience in NYC in other restaurants (Sarabeth's - worst brunch experience ever) I was under the impression that NYC just wasn't up to parr with my Montreal brunch expectations, BUT this place was a relief!  I kept it safe by ordering an eggs benny, my hollandaise sauce was just right and everything tasted great. I will definitely go again!

Had an awesome time at this restaurant- hostess seated us quickly and offered water to start with. We ordered the eggs Benedict and Claude Madam.  Both dishes were amazing.  Large portions and great prices.  The waiter was very helpful and offered suggestions.  The restaurant had a garden section but we opted out to stay inside due to the heat.  Will definitely go back to his spot has everything was amazing.

Très bien accueillis par le serveur et le responsable français. Les plats que nous avons commandés (poulet frits aux épinards) et le steak  étaient bien copieux et prix abordables. A recommander lors de votre séjour à Brooklyn

Went there to eat dinner with 2 friends, last evening. It has a beautiful garden in the back where we secured a table. We ordered a bottle of Rose wine, Moules provincial and French fries. Everything was delicious Great menu for a more robust dining experience We can't wait to go back A great find!

Opravdu jsme byli nadmíru spokojeni. Jak s milým personálem, tak se zajímavým prostředím a hlavně s jídlem. Navštívili jsme tuto restauraci hned dvakrát, abychom mohli ochutnat více jídel. Doporučuji wafle s ovocem a vejce Benedikt, ale věřím, že ostatní bude také vynikající.

The Menu has a French leaning to it with some deviations.  We ordered several dishes that were better than expected, even the onion soup which arrived late and a bit cool. The Beef B was very good as was the burger and mussels.  Even on the weekend the oyster selection had several choices for $1, which was a nice feature.  The rating is downgraded since the service was really odd and obtuse.  We were warned that this was hipster Brooklyn and we found really the oddest restaurant service we have experienced in years from both the hostess and the wait staff.  Hard to explain how really odd the interactions were.  Decent ambiance.
Our family of thirteen people came here for brunch and were very impressed. Everything was delicious. Service was a bit slow, but attentive nonetheless.
Small, cozy place with great food. Definitely worth it. Tartare was great and —the traditional French onion soup 👌🏼

So the French onion soup, escargot was wonderful. The tuna tartar and muscles tasted like salt water and the Provençal like the rosemary spice top fell off when they were preparing it. The muscles and tuna did not taste fresh. My friend steak was very tough although cooked perfectly. They were happy to take care of our concerns and gave us a round of drinks. The wine was wonderful however. Cute atmosphere and friendly staff.
I had the chicken and waffles for brunch. This may be some of the best chicken and waffles i have ever had. Great place to stop in Brooklyn  highly recommend!
Had a lovely meal with a group of friends...enjoyed the atmosphere and the food was great.  Enjoyed the Mussels Marinara and Roasted Salmon.  Will definately go back on our next trip
This place has a beautiful backdoor patio and lots of French favorites. I went for my anniversary and it was very enjoyable.

Super accueil par le responsable Eric qui ne vous fera manquer de rien.
Au niveau des plats, on se croirait à la maison... Rien à redire.
De bons vins sur la carte à un prix abordable pour NYC.
Très agréable le jardin.
J'aimerais bien tester le brunch.
Je reviendrai!
Un lugar de moda, con buenas propuestas para comer, ambiente joven bohemio chic. Muy lindo jardín para disfrutar. Generalmente hay que esperar para conseguir lugar pero vale la pena.
reviewTitle: Un lugar con onda, para comer.

reviewText: Great tasting, if a bit overpriced, bar food. Drinks are your standard bar fare. Staff was friendly and accommodating. We arrived really late and super hungry and they gladly took our order. The place has a cozy, relaxed vibe.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText:
So I have been to this location before on a business trip and had a good experience.  This time was not a good one.. my waitress seemed to forget about me and I was left waiting for a beer and also some silverwear.  She didn't come back and ask how things were and I had to ask again for silverwear.. Thus time I got some but the napkin was wet... The pan pizza was more bread than pizza and I asked for extra cheese..i would hate to see the amount of regular cheese...i had to squint to find it. 
The serving utensil for the pizza wad volcanic and I wad not warned...I guess I'm just disappointed this time... time to find a new place on my next trip..

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised.  The restaurant was very nice and the food was extremely good.  The drinks are reasonably priced and the food to.  Would definitely go back.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Great appetizers, outstanding variety of beers, and the burgers and ribs are very good.  Been here a few times and was never disappointed.   My problem is that we live so far away, but we come here every time we come to southern Long Island.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: The food was fantastic!  Seasoned very well, no MSG! Food temperatures was well. The ambiance of the restaurant was welcoming. Our problem with this very nice restaurant is the SERVICE!  It was non existent!!!  After 20 mins of waiting after we were seated, finally a waitress came over. Asked did anyone come to us yet and we said no. She had to check because she thinks it's someone else's table. Another 5 mins and she said your server will be with you shortly.  10 mins later, she wound up taking the order. We had to ask for just about everything. But, she was very pleasant and apologetic about the service. And at the end, we had to wait over 20 mins just to pay the bill! Wow!!! Call me crazy but I will come back and give them ONE more try.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: It really disappoints me when you go to a restaurant which has good food but the service is just horrible.  My family and I went to this fairly new restaurant on a Wednesday night.  The place was less than half full.  It took about five minutes for our waitress to greet us.  She took our drink and app. order.  The drinks came quickly but were wrong.  We did not see her again till after our main course was served which was also wrong.  Our drinks were empty but we were not asked if we would like refills.  We could see our waitress standing and chatting at the other side of the restaurant but we could not get her attention.  We finished our meal and waited along time for her to come over to take desert orders.  We then waited along time for her to come back so we could ask for the check.  The food was very good but the service was unacceptable.  I don't think we will go back.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: I had my boss in town with two others from corporate office. We went here for dinner and it was very good. The customer service was great and all the food came out on time and was good. Will be back.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText:
I was seated in BJ's Restaurant at 6:30pm. The restaurant was fairly empty. The waiter came over eventually and took our drink orders. He finally returned with the drinks and at that time we advised him that we wanted to place our orders. He stated he will be back in a few. He did return, but not in a few, he took the orders and it took forever for us to receive our meal. We were not the only one of his tables who were visibly upset. When I left I did not see the manager or I would have made my complaint at that time. 
I was ready to leave after sitting there for over 45 minutes.The food eventually came out at 7:20pm. Over 45 minutes for a party of 4 with nothing extravagant in the orders. We ordered dessert against my better judgement but they were having an awesome sale. Even though it took the food so long to come out of the kitchen we would have been at ease if the waiter was more attentive. He had certain tables he stayed at talking about the football game. We had to continually call him over for anything we wanted. Ex: refills, napkins, dessert.
We were in the restaurant for over 2 hours and that did not include waiting to be seated, just for food service. The food is great but the waitstaff needs more or better training. If I want to spend my night at the restaurant then that is fine, but I do not want to sit somewhere and be miserable waiting for food and decent service that everyone deserves and they paid their money for.
reviewTitle: Good food horrible service from the waitstaff!

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Not right in Green Acres mall, but just across the street. They have some great soups and good lunch combos at reasonable prices. The staff is friendly and the service was efficient.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Went here last night with a few friends. The hostess told us that if we wanted faster service to sit at the bar so we did. Elwin was our bartender and he was great! So helpful and nice! Food came out very fast and everyone enjoyed their food. Got a beer sampler which was awesome and Elwin recommended really good beers. Would definitely return and recommend.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Food and drink good as ever, nice atmosphere.   Clean bathrooms, decor like an old style Brewhouse.  The spicy chicken soba noodles are the best.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: First time at this establishment,  service was not excellent some of the food was cold and they took long to bring out the food  when it finally got there it wasn't bad the servers were pleasant.  The manager at no time came over to address or apologize for the lack of service.  Hopefully other folks have had good experiences . This restaurant didn't make a great expression on me

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: It was a spur of the moment Visit to this brand new restaurant instead of going to my regular hangout place. It was full of Friday night crowd but luckily we were seated within a short period of time. Lately Restaurant seating has become a real problem for me because most places you are right on top of other patrons, no elbow room and certainly no room on the table after you put your drinks down. Well I find plenty of roomy tables with plenty of elbow room. Enough distant from your neighboring patrons, TV's were not loud, so that speaking to your companion did not require shouting....😄. Drinks were on the button & the appetizers were on time to compliment the 🍹 with. The main courses were good portion size and right for the money 💰. We end up taking the dessert 🍨 home. A really nice place well suited for any night out in the town and they will definitely see me there often.
reviewTitle: A New Jem in the community

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: Popped in for a quick dinner and was delighted to learn all of the nice things that were on the menu. We had a 4 slice pizza pie, the BJ's which was light and flavorful. My husband enjoyed the brisket & bacon burger and I had the soup and salad with the soup served in a sourdough bread bowl. The soup was piping hot! The Caesar salad was tasty. What I didn't know is that it was unlimited. Next I had a bowl of tomato bisque which I think enjoyed more than the chowder. I was then able to take a large serving of bisque home and another salad which my daughter will have for dinner tonight. The hubby wanted to try the monkey bread beignet. Too sweet for me. Tasted like strawberry Quik. He enjoyed it, said the ice cream with it was really good. It seems like a great spot for families, friends or kids. We will definitely return to this nice surprise.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: First time visiting A Bj restaurant, and certainly won't be recommending or returning(this one at least). Tables were available yet long wait line form at the entrance. Took OVER 30 minute to receive anything. Drinks,food,getting the waitress attention, Yes, even getting a menu took this long. Pizookie (which we were most excited to receive) seemed under cooked and not what we expected. Items that we ordered but did not receive were added to our bill. Not a pleasant experience and don't think it will get any better soon.

placeAddress: 5 Green Acres Rd W Green Acres Common, Valley Stream, NY 11581
reviewText: I had a family dinner there. We heard about the other BJ's Restaurants and this was the first time we were eating at one. So we thought it should be really good. We were sorely disappointed. It was obvious they had recently opened and they were still figuring out how to cook and how to serve. Maybe they should just borrow the playbook from the other locations. It took 3 attempts (actual requests) to get a glass of water. The cutlery was dirty. The food tasted old or stale for most parts. We just paid and left.
reviewTitle: The venue is new...but that's no excuse

reviewText: Homophobic management. I went in with a group of 10 friends and my service dog, and was quickly told that apparently my dog had entered the kitchen when he had been in our possession the entire time. I was never asked whether my dog was a service dog, and never issued a warning. When I spoke with their team member, they mocked my last name and called me a slur. As a local Dumbo resident, I encourage others to spend their dollars at a more supportive location in the neighborhood. Horrible people.

My family and I came on the last day for the great roof deck. We did start out on the gaming side, though after shelling out $10 for coins for video games etc… none of the coins worked had to switch out for new ones, but some of them to didn’t work.

Waited a few minutes til 1pm for roof to open, separate entrance wristband needed. 

Limited beer list and food menu. One of the kegs was kicked took awhile for a new one to be installed, opted for the Pilsner instead. We ordered guac/chips…chicken tenders which came with Tots and “2 huge pork tacos”, not huge at all!

Views are great as well.
reviewTitle: Last Day For The Roof Top

reviewText: É um bar muito legal para tomar boas cervejas e comer bem. A partir das 4 pm o Rooftop abre e vale muito a visita para ver a vista. Ótimo atendimento e ambiente muito agradável.
Came here with my boyfriend while we stayed in dumbo. We were at the 1 hotel and I didn’t love their beer selection. Was so happy I tried it out here beer was great.

Wir haben das Randolph Beer zufällig entdeckt, als wir unsere Tour durch Brooklyn gemacht haben . Von außen etwas unscheinbar, sieht man in den großen Fenstern nur die Bierbraukessel, verbirgt sich im inneren eine tolle Bar! Hier kann man sich aus 24 verschiedenen Biersorten selber etwas aussuchen und Zapfen. Die Bestellungen laufen per App, die Kellner/Barkeeper/ Servicemitarbeiter sind schnell und super freundlich. Die Getränke schmecken gut und auch die Snacks sind zu empfehlen, die Portionen sind ausreichend groß. Preis und Leistung stimmen hier!!
Wir kommen gerne wieder :)
Friendly service, Decent bites, beers can be pricey as well as pitchers which come in a miniature size.

On my way to the bathroom, I made a wrong turn and found myself with a employee named Martin. We tripped and accidentaly dropped the food he was carrying, then he started shouting at me telling my that I should not be there repeatedly. I felt attacked and vulnerated by this individual. Good beer, nice place apart from the incident.

On her way to the bathroom, mu wife made a wrong turn and found herself with a employee named Martin. They trippped and accidentaly dropped the food he was carrying, then he started shouting at her telling her that she should not be there repeatedly. She felt attacked and   vulnerated by this individual. Good beer, nice place apart from the incident.

Bar descolado localizado em DUMBO, uma das áreas mais legais de NYC. Lá eu tomei uma das cervejas mais deliciosas que já provei em toda a minha vida: a COFFEE CREAM ALE. Não deixem de experimentar essa cerveja quando visitarem o local!

Quando mencionei ao barman o quanto tinha gostado da cerveja, ele fez questão de chamar o responsável por ela que me agradeceu pelo elogio.
Good food and a fantastic beer selection. Collect a card from the bar and serve your self beer from the wall of 24 beers.

We were lucky enough to arrive there during happy hour so enjoyed some delicious cheap beers and some yummy snacks.
Looking forward to getting there another time when I can pour my own beer from an impressive selection!
reviewTitle: I love beer and this is the place to enjoy it!

reviewText: Kiedy odwiedzasz kolejną atrakcję NY, trzeba zrobić przerwę na chwilę odpoczynku. To na Dumbo doskonałe miejsce. Można przekąsić dobre jedzenie i przede wszystkim napić się w upalny dzień, świetnego piwa. Dania wybiera się z karty i zamawia przy bufecie, ale jeśli chodzi o piwo, to najlepiej wziąć kartę i samemu sobie popróbować ze ścianki z dystrybutorami. Można nalać sobie po trochu różnych gatunków, nie koniecznie zamawiając od razu cały pokal jednego piwa. To świetny pomysł, tylko dla oszczędnych i chcących dalej zwiedzać :-), należy lekko ciągnąć za uchwyty. Na ekranie wyświetli się ile już wypiliśmy, a zwłaszcza za ile :-).
reviewTitle: Będąc na Dumbo i lubiąc dobre piwo - koniecznie!

reviewText:
Pedimos una cerveza y un vino tinto para descansar un poco y recuperar fuerzas, el ambiente es muy bueno, la decoración y la amabilidad del personal.
Sitio recomendado para hacer una parada y probar alguna de sus tantas cervezas.
reviewTitle: Lugar idóneo para una cerveza en Brooklyn

reviewText: We were parched after a hot walk across Brooklyn Bridge when we found this pub — what a lifesaver. Our teenaged kids loved the root beer and my husband and I enjoyed the beer collection. Service was impeccable.

I stopped by Randolph to have a beer with some friends and we enjoyed it. The place looks very hip, has fussball, pinball and other games. The beer selection is long enough to cover many tastes. The also have a terrace. They accept only payments by card.
reviewTitle: Great place to have a beer and a snack

reviewText: Pranzo in una giornata di pioggia newyorkese.. birra buona e xibo altrettanto. Lentini nel servizio e un po' spicci nei modi.

While showing friends from Italy around NYC I asked a friend living in Brooklyn Heights to join us and choose a place for lunch that offered good craft beer. He chose Randolph’s and we found the place pretty much empty on a weekday at lunchtime so we could seat ourselves anywhere we wanted. There’s a lot of “benchy” wooden seating and we easily found a comfortable place. There’s a really nice selection of craft beers available on draft and some are made right at Randolph’s.  Three of us chose an IPA made there and IMHO and those of my friends, too, it was excellent for sure.  One thing that was unsettling to each and every one of us was the very apparent curt and condescending attitude of the bartender, to whom all orders were placed.  Please trust me when I say we presented no problems and simply wanted to place our beer and food orders.  It was only after I asked her if we were somehow troubling her and assured me that we were not that she then acted courteously and without the attitude. I suppose we all can have “off moments,” so it wasn’t the end of the world. But most importantly I want to mention that not only the beer was excellent...the food was, too.  The menu is extensive for a brewery/pub establishment and the offerings appeared to be interesting, varied and appealing. A number of different dishes were ordered among us and everyone enjoyed their food.  The portions were nice-sized and very appealing to the eye when brought out to our table. All in all, I’d say that this very casual place is a nice choice for a very casual meal that will provide very satisfying drink and food.

Good beer, a great opportunity to try many different types, with a serve yourself tap. Atmosphere is relaxed, with vintage arcade games like pinball & skeeball, and a few comfy couches & overstuffed chairs. Staff is ok, seemed minimal during happy hour.

Three of us went to Randolph Beer on a weeknight about 7:00.  We did not have a reservation but were seated immediately.  The place has several different sections, we were in the picnic table part.  The servers were friendly and efficient.  The food was fine, the music was quite loud.  I had a Lil' Heaven beer, which was delicious.
reviewTitle: Tasty beer in a casual setting

reviewText:
My family and who live near by was coming back from a walk in the very windy Brooklyn bridge park and Brooklyn heights. It was my wife’s suggestion, plus pleasantly surprised. I had written one of the first reviews of Randolph’s, but it was suspended due to content I don’t understand why.

The place was packed around 1245 Saturday afternoon with a birthday party of 20 people in the front room and other large tables. The hostess was busy along with Antonio who was our server. Beer selection is great the food we ordered though took a while to come out was good too. Note to self: come earlier on the weekend.

We’ll be back.

We visited a couple of times. The bar in the front was always fairly full with say four or five seats available. There are TVs I all areas. We sat in the back and had meals of the appetizers. This is great bar food. I do not know what gastro pub food is but this is the type of variety of quality snack. food that is hard to get in the neighborhood. The creamy Mac n cheese, the flat bread and wings were standouts, and the ‘desert’ the giant pretzel, is a repeater, but even standard chicken fingers and the fries were always finished. The nachos are atypical but fun.
The varied drinks were  fine. The lack of a fourth star is just that there are no bargains here but the prices are typical of similar places in todays world. Everyone in our group are repeat customers and can’t wait to go back. No frills or pretentious, but that is just what we want!
Stopped here recently for a cocktail or 2 on a nice sunny day. Enjoyed the good pours from the bartender and the tasty large pretzel.
A great sports bar.    The menu is good and the atmosphere is very friendly. The bartender makes all the patrons feel special.

I decided to try this place for lunch today (a Thursday), after I saw a $10 special advertised on a chalk board out front,. For ten bucks, I got a burger, fries and beer.

The interior is aged and a bit divey, with at least half a dozen tables for dining, and a long bar. There is exposed brick on one side, and a wall adorned mostly with photographs of sports stars (many autographed) on the other.  I counted ten flat-screen televisions on the walls.  An Irish flag was on the middle of the ceiling, and the woman behind the bar spoke with an Irish accent.  

My hamburger came in an English muffin "bun" and was fine.  The "regular" fries were outstanding.  They were a bit like the kind of fries you get at Checker's, only better.

This is a good place to hang out at and watch a sporting match - and if you do, order the "regular" fries to go with your beer.

Tap House has a good location...more so if you're walking.  The food is good but it's basically bar food.  They have a good asst. of beers and the prices are good.  It's a good atmosphere and friendly staff.  Good music... bear in mind it's a fairly small place.

I went here with a friend for a burger and beer to watch game. I was generally good, my only issue was that it was very, very loud. I don't generally like loud places so a bit of a bummer. The noise was from the music and televisions not the people in the bar. The Burgers, beers, and service was good. I never went back so I guess that sums it up pretty well, because I eat in the area frequently.
reviewTitle: Nice Place to watch Giants game

placeAddress: 8710 Rockaway Beach Blvd, Far Rockaway, NY 11693-1610
reviewText: I stopped in just as the bakery opened and scored warm croissants, plus croissant loaf and a fabulous sticky bun for breakfast. And peanut butter cookies for an afternoon snack. I wish I could have tasted everything!
reviewTitle: The aroma alone is worth a stop!

placeAddress: 8710 Rockaway Beach Blvd, Far Rockaway, NY 11693-1610
reviewText: I end my morning workout with nice hot coffee. The cold brew is good too.  For a special treat try the brownie, vegan carrots muffin and honey croissant. They rock pastry. My son is an addict now   I am trying to limit the joy to twice a week. Very nice people make you feel welcome.

placeAddress: 8710 Rockaway Beach Blvd, Far Rockaway, NY 11693-1610
reviewText: It is well worth a trip to Far Rockaway not just for the great beach and a fantastic ferry ride from Manhattan but for the wonderful Rockaway Beach Bakery.  Without doubt they serve the best Bacon, Egg, and Cheese in NYC.  Served on a buttery scone with scallion menu and real thick-cut bacon.  Wow!  Their cheddar and jalapeño scones are great and the chocolate chip cookies.  Don't miss out on the Hot Chocolate.  The owner baker is a charming young surfer who said she had wanted to do her own thing.  Clearly she is loved by residents of Far Rockaway. If you take the ferry, get on the shuttle bus to 86th Street, walk back 2 blocks and cross the street, loosen your belt, and fall in love.

placeAddress: 8710 Rockaway Beach Blvd, Far Rockaway, NY 11693-1610
reviewText: Aunt Helen's Coffee Cake, Chocolate Croissants, Chocolate Cherry Scones, Ham and Swiss Everything Croissants are fantastic! Closed Monday. Cash only. Everything else looks wonderful too....take a bag of goodies to the surfer beach and watch the show...good beach on a budget for local NYers. The A train all the way to Broad Channel. the Shuttle to 90th/Holland. Walk towards the beach, make a left on Rock Beach Blvd.

placeAddress: 8710 Rockaway Beach Blvd, Far Rockaway, NY 11693-1610
reviewText:
Stumbled upon the 2-for-1 Sunday Happy Hour (3p-4p) and what a delight! I had the BEST ham and swiss on a croissant, followed by Grandma's Plum Cake which was amazing.  It would have been a steal at $5 for the sandwich - but with the 2-for-1....such a deal!
We ate in the darling little cafe (inside, although there's plenty of backyard space, too). Super friendly service and delicious baked treats.

I have loved the Kings Highway area near the Q and B train station for many years. My younger son grew up on E. 22nd St. & Ave. P just off Kings Highway. To stroll on the Highway and enjoy the many fruit and vegetable stores and all the wonderful shops has always been a pleasure. I find the area colorful, lively, and convenient. The bagel shop near Ocean Ave. has everything you could want in a bagel shop, the Turkish restaurant on Kings Highway & E. 19th has very tasty food, there's a huge Russian shop with all kinds of delicacies across from the restaurant. I used to frequent Minerva Diner years back and was sorry when it closed. There was a health food store near the Kings Highway train station, but that also closed years back. I often shop at a discount store corner of 18th Street and a home decor and appliance store on same block. Big Banana is great for both produce and supermarket fare. Kings Highway Bakery is a wonderful bakery. I love the Amazon Cafe off Kings Highway on E. 12th St. There are numerous 99 cent shops along Kings Highway. I went to an acupuncture and herbal doctor  over where Adelmans used to be and they helped a great deal with my arthritis and allergy problems. My mom (who lived in New Jersey towards the end of her years) loved coming into Brooklyn for our family reunion at Adelmans; we all loved Adelmans. The food was wonderful - the soups, the corn beef sandwiches, the liver & peppers & onions - all their food was great. Very sorry when they closed down. I loved walking with my kids on Kings Highway and doing my shopping there. It's one of those old fashioned neighborhoods, somewhat international, with many ethnic restaurants, including Japanese restaurants, & also a great mix of people which I love, where you can still get plenty of fresh fruits and vegetables, enjoy fine pastries at the Kings Highway Bakery & generally enjoy a lively and fun (& convenient) experience.
reviewTitle: Kings Highway area - Great to Walk - Great to Shop

reviewText: The bread here is fantastic!! The fancy cookies are delicious.. well worth the price!! Ive ordered cakes from here before and they are delicious as well!! Great place in a changing neighborhood!

Old School, Small Town Bakery. From a time when quality and the customer came first. Delicious, mouth watering breads, fresh baked. I, we, finished a loaf of their famous prosciutto bread and were looking for more. You can't find this kind of quality and taste in any supermarket. We haven't tasted a better pignoli cookie, soft and tasty. The rainbow cookies, the biscotti's, the semolina bread makes it all worth the trip.
The owner, Rocky, a fourth-generation artisan baker is hands-on and has been for almost 30 years.

Enjoy!

Its hard to find an authentic baker nowadays but if you are in Brooklyn and you want to sample the best there is, then you owe it to yourself to stop at KingsHighway bakery. Fantastic freshly baked italian bread, cookies and cakes, fresh and hot all day. Fast and friendly service  and the price is right. You won't be disappointed. Get over there today!
What could i say, i own the place. Come on down see for yourself. Baking fresh italian bread in this location for 30 years.

Paramos para tomar unas cervezas y al entrar vimos que ponía claramente que el servicio de atención se realiza a desde la barra. Nos dirijimos ahí y pedimos nuestras cañas. La camarera lo más antipático que puedas imaginar. Se quedó con la visa y no nos la quería devolver. Dijo que nos la daba al querer irnos. Nos pareció muy mal pk además ni una explicación del porqué. Aún así nos sentamos, pk estábamos cansados. El lugar es bonito en realidad teníamos pensado pasar un buen rato y jugar al fútbolin.... Siguiente contacto con la camarera. De mala manera nos responde a una simple pregunta de cambio de sitio, pues estaban realizando alguna mejora y las ventanas del local estaban abiertas de par en par y el viento era un poco molesto. Sentados nos llega un ávido del banco de pago con la tarjeta. Es decir, la camarera ha probado la tarjeta sin consentimiento! Eso fue ya lo último para querer irnos corriendo. En fin, nyc es muy bonito para que te estropee la tarde una chica sin preparación para atención al cliente. Creo que el dueño del local debe saber que no es bueno tener personas poco preparadas
reviewTitle: Bonito sitio, buena CERVEZA, PERSONAL NULO

reviewText: We visited Randolph Beer after walking across the Brooklyn Bridge, before heading back via the Manhattan Bridge.  Just the thing for a couple of folks with tired feet, in need of refreshment!  The place was absolutely packed (a beautiful Saturday afternoon), but we found a table outside to enjoy the day.  I was impressed with how family-friendly the set-up inside was - games and spaces for children (and others) worked into the seating areas.  Very cool place to spend an afternoon!  Oh - and the beer was good, too!
reviewTitle: Perfect spot for a pick-me up!

reviewText:
We were walking around Brooklyn seeing the sights when we fell on this place.  A great concept of a beer wall with 24 micro breweries to sample, you get a card and then you pick up a glass and go and sample!!  There were some nice ales and cider that our party enjoyed.

If your in the area and like different ales, give this place a go. Great beer, staff and atmosphere.

Un bar autóctono donde podremos degustar una gran cantidad de cervezas artesanales, sin llegar a ser turístico y cuyo ambiente relajado y distendido le gustará a cualquiera.

Lo primero que llama la atención del lugar son los enormes depósitos de cervezas situado en la entrada, ya hacen presagiar que estamos en un bar distinto. Lo segundo que nos sorprende son los 20 tiradores localizados en una pared del bar bajo el título “beer yourself” y es aquí donde se encuentra la esencia del lugar. En la barra te proporcionan una tarjeta personal con la que podrás ir llenando tu copa con la cerveza y la cantidad que desees. Cada tirador tiene un contador que irá sumando dinero gastado en tu tarjeta en función del uso. El mecanismo me pareció grandioso, ya que deja total autonomía a los clientes para elegir el tipo y la cantidad de cerveza que quiere tomar, dándole opción de probar multitud de cervezas.

Respecto a la comida, el restaurante destaca por el uso de materia prima de calidad y productos frescos. Nosotros optamos por una hamburguesa con queso, la cual estaba exquisita, acompañada con una guarnición de patatas fritas caseras aderezadas con unas especias, dándoles o toque picante buenísimo. Casi podría decir que han sido las mejores papas fritas que he comido en la ciudad de New York.

El precio va en sintonía con los que encuentras en la ciudad, es adecuado para la calidad y servicio que ofrece, además lógicamente va en función de las cervezas consumidas. Yo acudí con mi pareja, pedimos dos hamburguesas con su guarnición de papas y aproximadamente 4 copas de cervezas, nos costó todo 60$.

Si unimos la calidad de la comida a la variedad de cervezas y el mecanismo utilizado para servirla, es sin duda un restaurante de obligada visita para todos los amantes de las cervezas.

I loved the self service beer tasting and like that you could buy an ounce or two or 12 or 16. Wash your mug, put you little card on the machine and taste away.  While you pay by the ounce and it tallies right on a screen to let you know what it cost, the beer is very very expensive considering that you are really serving yourself.
reviewTitle: Nice place to get a craft beer

reviewText:
Across street from WeWork building. This beer hall is laid out across a very confusing three levels. 
One of these places where you have to order (and tip at point of purchase) and then go to your table and wait to be served. 
An annoying set up.
But the beers are good, the giant pretzel is delicious and I always like a beer hall. 
The view is basically the entrance to the Brooklyn Bridge not exactly a vista but I'd happily go back. 
Good friends, a nice day and beer is a pretty good equation. 
I suspect this place is a lot less enjoyable December through March.

First trip to Brooklyn but met a friend who lived in the area so therefore knew of good places to visit. Loved it I drink cider only one to choose from from but wow it was good . We were there on a Monday afternoon so very quiet but must be a really buzzy place at busier times . Worth the walk
reviewTitle: Unusual location great choice of drinks

reviewText: Por alguma razão, não fiquei com vontade de voltar. Mas o lugar é bonito, decoração impecável, auto-serviço bacana de cervejas... mas falta algo.
reviewTitle: Lugar bonito, tudo certo, mas falta clima.

reviewText: Micro brewery and saw the tanks on the other side of the building. Decided to go in. Hidden entrance but when inside, great atmosphere! Fantastic place and beer!

We came Saturday afternoon after the Woman’s March in the city and we needed a beer and snacks to munch on as we were on our feet for half the day. My wife mentioned we should go to Randolph’s before going home.

We live in Vinegar Hill Brooklyn so it was on our way home and it hit the spot. The Hall was packed with groups even a birthday gathering in the upper level seating. We sat in the back at a large blue banquette and the table was made from an old door. 

We shared the sliders and big-a$$ pretzel with spicy beer cheese. Yum!!! I had a few beers by “Other Half” and my wife had a Bloody Mary (see photo) from a pre made dispenser.

Definitely wanna go back as it’s in my neighborhood. The entrance is on prospect street so they have a sandwich board to alert patrons...

Cheers

I can't say that this place is anything spectacular even though it can be hard to get reservations on a Sunday. The food is OK and the ambiance of the place is fine. There are some decent dishes on the menu, but doesn't compare to many other French places I've been to. This is one of the only French places in the area, so if that is what you are craving, it may be your only choice.

Although French, Mominette put out some (wait for it) delicious fried chicken. Everything is prepared perfectly, like a solid bistro in Paris. The charming courtyard, polite service and delicious food we enjoyed at lunch is like a secret discovery. (although Mominette is well known in BKLN.) Because is it located on an out of the way otherwise anonymous block of Bushwick. Recommend!
reviewTitle: Best meal of my trip to Brooklyn!

reviewText: Nous avons été dans ce restaurant parce que l'on ventait son calme dans une cour intérieur, cuisine française. La cour est plaisante, ombragée, calme, c'est important car à New york tout est bruyant. La nourriture c’est bien moyen et la carte variée, coq au vin, cassoulet, salade niçoise, saumon..., le vin français, beau nom, beaujolais, châteaux de bordeaux, une chose est sur il ne vient pas de France.

Our niece was married under the canopy roof in the rain, surrounded by family and friends. Mominette provided fabulous appetizers and specialty drinks along with a selection of 5 entrees and 4 fabulous desert cakes. Service was impeccable and only surpassed by the food.

Very authentic Brooklyn restaurant established in 1939 .Old World French charm with comfortable seating within the bar setting. Specials were generous and the Seafood pasta was perfect paired with the Bordeaux. Carrot fennel soup was the best ever,as it warmed.the palate and the soul.  Service team worked well together and Made our family visit comfortable to celebrate Nick's running the Brooklyn Half Marathon and many birthdays and happy moments. Wonderful experience.

We had an absolutely lovely dinner there on Christmas Eve. I had the escargots, the ratatouille, the "buche" and some sparkly rosé and it was all really good.
The service was great as well, with a (french) waiter who took great care of us and was really helpful and fun to talk to! 
To be recommended in Williamsburg!

Went for brunch last weekend and it was fantastic! Our party got the pancake, the eggs benedict, and an omelette and each one was excellent. Also has a great French ambiance. Wait staff was attentive and also very good. Would definitely go back.

It doesn't hurt that Mominette is a few steps from my sister's apartment, but this is one of my absolute favorites in Brooklyn. It's a beautiful little gem with a hidden garden and a funky interior. I almost licked my Croque Madame plate clean.
Very hipster but beautiful garden and very tasty breakfast at an affordable price. We were five people and they accommodated us very well. Service was fast and friendly.

Decent french food, though I am not a fan of french food. Its more of a New American / French combo, hipster style. Waitstaff are nice, cocktails are great, and its likely youll have a good dinner here.
The brunch menu was varied, food was well prepared, service was cheerful and attentive.  Would go back again.
reviewTitle: Funky Place, good food, good service

reviewText:
The appearance of this "French restaurant" held such promise. From the exterior to the inside decor you could be forgiven for thinking you were in 1960s Montmartre rather than urban Bushwick. If only such attention was extended to their menu and service. 

The first surprise came when our "waiter" finally deigned to bring our menus. Rather than the Gallic cuisine one would expect it seemed to be a hotch-potch of Italian dishes and American truck-stop fare with a few obvious French staples thrown in for good measure. I don't think I've seen Coq Au Vin on a menu since the 1970s! Also, the starter we wanted to order was off the menu. 

We settled on a portion of oysters, which to their credit, were beautifully served on a generous bed of ice with lemon, accompanied by the customary dish of wine vinegar. All good so far until... Ugghhh!! What on earth is that red substance in the other 'petit bol' ? Tomato sauce!!  After the arduous task of catching the waiter's eye I asked if they didn't have any Mignonette or at least Tabasco as one would expect. The response was a haughty negative with no alternative offered. Though given the establishment's "idiosyncratic" understanding of how to serve oysters I was half expecting he'd suggest peanut butter. 

Not perhaps the most auspicious start to a meal but at least the lighting was nice and the Sauvignon Blanc crisp and zesty. 

Then the mains. After telling the waiter we were both vegetarian and ordering the housemade pasta, sans merguez sausage, it was a bit of a disappointment this hadn't been conveyed to the chef and my dish arrived full of pork. 

Again, my retina got a good work-out trying to attract the waiter's attention. Once I made my grievance clear and reiterated that we had told him we were both vegetarian and requested meat-free dishes - which in my understanding generally includes pork sausage - he picked up my plate and actually quipped "OK, i'll pick the meat out then, shall I?" Incredulous for a second, I then responded "What did you say?" But his back was turned as he entered the kitchen. 

If I wasn't with such delightful company and wishing to salvage the rest of the dinner it would have been his teeth he was picking out of the bowl. 

Once returned - sausage free - the dish was pleasant enough, albeit with the 'al dente' ratio perhaps inverted between the pasta and vegetables. My companion's dish was of a similar standard: palatable enough, but nothing remarkable. 

To conclude, I do not think I have ever encountered such obnoxious, unprofessional staff working in a restaurant, and I have encountered my fair share of bad service in thirty years of dining out. One would think at the prices they are charging ($116 for food of the standard one might expect from one of the tourist-trap bistros on Pigalle) they would be grateful for all the custom they got and treat diners with the courtesy they deserve. Evidently not. 

I wouldn't eat here again if I was awaiting execution on Death Row and this was offered as my last meal.

Brunch at this French bistro is a popular neighbourhood activity, since there really isn’t much around but a paucity of bars amongst an abundance of random pawn shops and fried chicken joints. Mominette stands out – not in frontage but in quality – and their outdoor space at the back is delightful. The spinach & goat cheese croissant ($10) is a crowd favourite, and the French toast ($9) is colourful. The Sunday special oyster Benedict was wonderful, with the shellfish deep fried and placed on sturdy poached eggs and English muffins. I also had a tasty beets’n’bourbon cocktail that was begging for some ice and a taller glass. Though it can be expensive, service is great, and the kitchen is quick to fulfill orders at busy periods.
This restaurant will surely go down as one of the forerunners in Bushwick’s blossoming. 

delusionaryculinary.wordpress.com
reviewTitle: Excellent brunch, but some may find it pricey and snobby

reviewText: I’ve eaten here three, maybe four times, and I won’t go back because of the atmosphere. I tried and failed at being comfortable at this restaurant. The owner is a jerk and the staff is very uneven. There is nothing wrong with the food, it’s pretty good, but I’m  generally not treated very well by the snobby, elitist hipster waitstaff. That’s all.
Приятная незаметная кафешка во французском стиле скрытая неприметной дверью в Бушвике, но тем не менее готовят отличный крок мадам, за что им спасибо!

Mominette is French Bistro and Oyster Bar ($1 oyster on Monday) on knickerbocker Ave in Bushwick. 
I went yesterday for a Sunday brunch (which ends at 5pm!!), it was absolutely fantastic!
I've got the Norwegian Benedict while my husband had the Eggs Florentine and a friend the Rilette Sandwich, all 3 plates were stunning, fresh bread, fresh food and very nicely cooked.
The service was attentive and quiet fast. The owners share a bakery that explain also why the bread is soo good! They also offer us a complimentary "pain au chocolat" which no need to say was awesome. I was skeptic about ordering in the first place the Croque Madam instead of the Norwegian Benedict (a lot of place in the city pretend to be French without any knowledge of the basic French Bistro cousine) but know that I taste their skills next time I'll be pleased to try the full menu.

We had a party of 7 for dinner and made a reservation to eat in the garden at the back of the restaurant. What an absolutely lovely setting! The seating is casual and very comfortable, and the service is excellent. Everyone in our group loved the experience - interesting and fun cocktails to start, and then the meal that followed was wonderful! We shared several appetizers, including gnocchi gratin, polenta, potato gratin, and onion soup - each was perfection. We had a wide variety in our dinner selections, but everyone was very pleased. One said it was the best burger he's ever eaten, another raved about the coq au vin, and the duck was apparently perfect. I had roasted vegetables with a side of mac and cheese - might have been a boring choice elsewhere, but here the vegetables were tasty and perfectly cooked, and the generous portion of mac and cheese was light and flavorful. To top off the evening dessert was served with candles for my (adult) son's birthday, and the staff sang "Happy Birthday" in French! One person from our group is from France and she declared the food up to the standards of her country. What better recommendation would you want?

We went here for dinner last night with a few friends. It was a 30 minute wait for a table outside so we are inside. I had the most amazing gnocchi gratin with really rich cheese flavor. I also had a hamburger which was not special, you have to add-on the cheese for extra charge and there was no sauce or onions. The sweet potato fries that it came with were perfect. My boyfriend is French and was happy to order the boeuf bourguignon which was really great. It was definitely pricey but for a most part a great meal. My other friends ordered the beet salad and the plate of grilled veggies.

I have visited this restaurant several times over the last year and each time I thought it really good French food. This local eatery has the most competent staff and slight changes to a dish are easily accommodated. My last visit at the end of March, my companion and myself decided to start with the escargot which we shared and then we moved on to our own main dishes - she the steak frite and me the confit du canard. Both wonderful, the steak was amazing, tender and perfectly cooked. We then sat for a while and chatted, but soon came to the conclusion that we would like dessert. The Chocolate Mousse is to die for - choc topped and delicious, again we shared - but boy did we scrape that glass clean! 
Even when you have finished eating, there never seems to a push to get you out. This is an enjoyable evening out by any standards.
reviewTitle: Far from France but with the right flavours.

reviewText: Mominette has the most gorgeous backyard garden in Bushwick. When the weather's nice, you should definitely go here for brunch. I think dinner is pricey for what they offer, but the brunch is spot on. Unfortunately, they are cash only which is why I took off one star. Who is cash only these days?

Went here on the way to visit my parents in the neighborhood the pastries are so yummy! They have a lot of options. The ladies at the counter we’re all friendly, a women was walking around greeting people which I though was very pleasant. A place to sit and enjoy some coffee and treats

This Korean franchise of Paris Baguette is known for sweet breads and dessert cakes.  My family bought some sweet breads and two Bing-soo(shave ice with topping) desserts.  Both the sweet bread and the bing-soo were very good.
There is a small free parking next to the building but it is hard to find a spot.

placeAddress: 108 Lexington Ave, New York City, NY 10016-8927
reviewText:
This is the fresh, authentic, delicately seasoned Indian cuisine. We had a party of 12, celebrating a birthday and the staff was so accommodating, It is a small venue and one can actually have a conversation, the background music was low, lights dim. We had the benefit of a food connoisseur ordering for us. Some newbies to the cuisine , some well-versed. 
This is not a made for American palate curry curry curry, though the curries are available. 
Each biryani was a stand out, not greasy, not gummy. The mulligatawny variation is a thickened style, mild coriander/coconut soup.
I will be back
reviewTitle: Delightful choice for diners who want to chat while dining. gentle ambiance

placeAddress: 108 Lexington Ave, New York City, NY 10016-8927
reviewText:
4 day trio to NYC. I really enjoy indian food and have tried it all over the world. The Dhaba was recommended to me by a friend who lived for 10 years in NYC. I have never eaten worst indian food! I ordered samosas and onion bhajis for starter - and these were ok. The lemonade they made was like a salty soapwater drink - not drinkable. The main course - and this dish - chicken tikka masala - should be the flagship of every indian restaurant all over the world - was like italian tomato-cream sauce for cannelloni. it lacked of every inidan spices and herbs for a genuine taste. It hab no hotness to it and tastet dull and the chicken breast made the impression of just having been added before serving and not been marinated in the sauce. The rice was unsalted, tasted like overwatered parboiled long grain rather than basmati rice. The naan tasted like someone hab just opened a ready made 5 a pack supermarket package and warmed it up in the microwave.

So - very dissapointing- not authentic and not even tasty at all. Lets just hope NYC has better indian food to offer.
reviewTitle: They should try their own food once in a while....

placeAddress: 108 Lexington Ave, New York City, NY 10016-8927
reviewText: This restaurant is absolutely stunning.  My husband and I ate here for a late lunch.  We missed the daily buffet from 11:30am to 3pm.  We had an absolute gastronomic feast!
